intro: Hedyotis albonerva, commonly known as white-veined geranium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often with two distinct lobes on the petals. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Hedyotis albonerva is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
